intro: Adinandra celebica, commonly known as the Celebes adinandra, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian islands of Sulawesi and the Moluccas. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in tropical rainforest environments, often found in shaded undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
